newsitem.title: SYRIA: Syrian vice-president Khaddam to Iran for talks.
newsitem.headline: Syrian vice-president Khaddam to Iran for talks.

text.p: Syrian Vice-President Abdel-Halim Khaddam leaves for Tehran on Sunday for talks with Iranian leaders on regional developments and bilateral ties, officials said.

They said Khaddam would be accompanied by Foreign Minister Farouq al-Shara and several other ministers who would attend meetings of the joint Syrian-Iranian commission which is assigned to coordinate and promote bilateral cooperation.

Khaddam's visit follows harsh criticism by Iran's media of Syria's approval of a decision by Arab ministers backing the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in its dispute with Iran over ownership of three islands in the Gulf.
But several Iranian officials said in statetents later that ties with Syria, which backed Iran during its 1980-1988 war with Iraq, were strategic.

In a strongly worded statement after a meeting in Cairo on December 29, the Damascus Declaration states -- Syria, Egypt and the six members of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) -- demanded that Iran withdraw from the islands in favour of the UAE which also claims them.
